Sentence: Recently, a new layered compound Bi O 4 S 3 with T c ï âï 8.6 K has triggered intensive research interests, leading to a class of BiS 2 -based superconductors including LnO x 1-F x BiS 2 (Lnï =ï La, Ce, Pr, Nd) with Tcï  up to ï 10 K .
Upon further cooling, a sharp superconducting transition with Tcï  of 3.8 K, which is sizably higher than that of Sr 0.5 La 0.5 FBiS 2 with T c ï â¼ï 2.8 K, can be clearly seen.

The fact that T c decreases monotonously with pressure in the present Sr 0.5 La 0.5 FBiSe 2 sample is in contrast to other BiS 2 -based superconductors such LnO x 1-F x BiS 2 and Sr x 1-Ln x FBiS 2 systems , where the T c is enhanced to 10 K by pressure.
Recall that T c is enhanced in most BiS 2 -or BiSe 2 -based compounds as typically in LaO x 1-F x BiSe 2 where T c is enhanced to 6.5 K at 2.37 GPa .
Therefore compared with the pressure effect on other mentioned materials the pressure effect in the Sr 0.5 La 0.5 FBiSe 2 compound is abnormal.
Very recently, an isostructural LaO x 1-F x BiSe 2 compound has been reported to exhibit enhanced-superconductivity with T c of 3.5 K compared to the low-T c phase in LaO x 1-F x BiS 2 ï  [5, 15].

Raw material: Sr x 1-Ln x FBiS 2 (Lnï =ï La, Ce)
